data.name: A1_a_Criteria
data.value: It is checked whether the dataset has a "direct" download service (WFS or WCS) (weight 15)

data.name: A1_b_Criteria
data.value: It is checked whether the dataset has a view service (WMS or WMTS) (weight 15)

data.name: A1_c_Criteria
data.value: It is checked whether the dataset is available through the "Geonorge download api" (weight 15)

data.name: A1_d_Criteria
data.value: Checking if dataset is available as a download service for predefined datasets (Atom Feed) (weight 5)

data.name: A1_e_Criteria
data.value: It is checked whether the protocols that provide access to the datasets are openly accessible and readable with standard IT tools. Which we consider to be sufficient if one has provided a download URL with Https response (weight 40)

data.name: A1_f_Criteria
data.value: The protocol allows for an authentication and authorisation procedure, where necessary

data.name: A1_Label
data.value: A1: Datasets are available through standard web protocols and open standardised services

data.name: A2_a_Criteria
data.value: This requirement is not checked as all Mareano data should be available for download (weight 0)

data.name: A2_Label
data.value: A2: Metadata are accessible, even when the data are no longer available

data.name: Accesible_Description
data.value: Datasets must be accessible through standardized and open interfaces.

data.name: Accesible_Label
data.value: Accessible

data.name: Common
data.value: Download requirements status

data.name: Delivery_Statusdeficient
data.value: Bad

data.name: Delivery_Status_Deficient
data.value: Bad

data.name: Delivery_Status_Satisfactory
data.value: Satisfactory

data.name: Delivery_Status_Useable
data.value: Useable

data.name: DownloadRequirements
data.value: Download requirements

data.name: F1_a_Criteria
data.value: It is checked that there is metadata in Geonorge. (All metadata in Geonorge have persistent and unique identifiers and are searchable on the web). The request returns metadata in a standardized form. (weight 25)

data.name: F1_Label
data.value: F1: (Meta)data are assigned a globally unique and persistent identifier

data.name: F2_a_Criteria
data.value: At least three thematic keywords must be entered in the metadata (weight 10)

data.name: F2_b_Criteria
data.value: Title should be a maximum of 100 characters to provide a simple and consistent name that is easy searchable (weight 5)

data.name: F2_c_Criteria
data.value: The description should be at least 200 characters to be able to provide sufficient information about the dataset and not longer than 600 characters to obtain a good but concise and precise description of what the dataset contains. (There are specific metadata elements where you can enter supplementary information, lineage, quality, update frequency, possibly link to other documentation such as Data Product Specifications, Product sheets, etc). (weight 10)

data.name: F2_Label
data.value: F2: Data are described with rich metadata

data.name: F3_a_Criteria
data.value: Metadata should have a unique reference to the dataset. Datasets should not only be referred to by name, but also by the unique identifier (uuid) for the dataset. This must be entered in the metadata together with a namespace. (Datasets are defined with unique IDs in Geonorge's namespace register if they have entered dataset-IDs in metadata) (weight 25)

data.name: F3_Label
data.value: F3: Metadata clearly and explicitly include the identifier of the data they describe

data.name: F4_a_Criteria
data.value: Metadata located in Geonorge is searchable through CSW API (OGC) and DCAT API (W3C). This makes metadata searchable through standardized APIs for the geodata industry, research and science and "open data" industry both nationally and internationally. (weight 25)

data.name: F4_Label
data.value: F4: (Meta)data are registered or indexed in a searchable resource

data.name: Findable_Description
data.value: Metadata and data should be easy to find for both humans and computers. Machine-readable metadata are essential for automatic discovery of datasets and services

data.name: Findable_Label
data.value: Findable

data.name: I1_a_Criteria
data.value: Metadata for geodata must be established in accordance with the metadata standard ISO19115. (Metadata in Geonorge is based on the mentioned standard.) (weight 20)

data.name: I1_b_Criteria
data.value: The dataset should be available in internationally known open formats. Check for GML for vector data or tiff / jpg for raster data (weight 10)

data.name: I1_c_Criteria
data.value: If the dataset is offered as GML, the dataset must validat according to the Data Product Specification's UML model (weight 20)

data.name: I1_Label
data.value: I1: Metadata and datasets are represented through international, well-documented and accessible standards.

data.name: I2_a_Criteria
data.value: Topic category must be filled in metadata to categorize the dataset in an international context (weight 10)

data.name: I2_b_Criteria
data.value: National theme category must be filled in metadata to categorize the dataset in a national context (weight 10)

data.name: I2_Label
data.value: I2: Metadata and datasets shall use vocabularies, concepts and code lists and refer to searchable resources on the web that are managed with unique identifiers.

data.name: I3_a_Criteria
data.value: Metadata must refer to terms that are described / defined in the dataset's UML model in Geonorge's object catalog (SOSI model register) (weight 10)

data.name: I3_b_Criteria
data.value: The dataset must be modeled in UML and the metadata must refer to the UML model in Geonorge's object catalog (SOSI model register) (weight 20)

data.name: I3_Label
data.value: I3: (Meta)data include qualified references to other (meta)data

data.name: Interoperable_Description
data.value: The data usually need to be integrated with other data. In addition, the data need to interoperate with applications or workflows for analysis, storage, and processing.

data.name: Interoperable_Label
data.value: Interoperabel

data.name: lesmer
data.value: Read more

data.name: lesmindre
data.value: Read less

data.name: Productspesification
data.value: Productspesification

data.name: R1_a_Criteria
data.value: Licenses in the Geonorge register meet this requirement (weight 30)

data.name: R1_Label
data.value: R1.1: (Meta)data are released with a clear and accessible and resolvable data usage license

data.name: R2_a_Criteria
data.value: Lineage must be provided with more than 200 characters (weight 10)

data.name: R2_b_Criteria
data.value: Update frequency must be specified in metadata (weight 5)

data.name: R2_c_Criteria
data.value: Link to Data Product Specification must exist in metadata(weight 10)

data.name: R2_d_Criteria
data.value: Scale for the dataset must be provided in the metadata(weight 5)v

data.name: R2_e_Criteria
data.value: Coverage map must be provided in the metadata (by municipality or grid) (weight 5)

data.name: R2_f_Criteria
data.value: Purpose must be provided in the metadata (weight 5)

data.name: R2_Label
data.value: R1.2: Metadata about quality, coverage, processing, calculations, etc. must be provided.

data.name: R3_a_Criteria
data.value: Metadata must follow the standards: ISO19115 and DCAT-AP-NO (weight 15)

data.name: R3_b_Criteria
data.value: Datasets are delivered on international open vector formats such as GML or raster / gridded data such as TIFF / JPEG / NetCDF (weight 15)

data.name: R3_Label
data.value: R1.3 (Meta)data meet domain-relevant community standards

data.name: RatingBad
data.value: Poor (less than 50%): The dataset has major shortcomings in terms of meeting FAIR principles and needs to be improved in many areas

data.name: RatingDescription
data.value: There have made various tests to evaluate datasets in relation to the FAIR criteria. These are our interpretations, which then assess the criteria in relation to standards and protocols used for spatial data in Norway and Europe. For more information on which calculations we use for each indicator, look at the details of FAIR assessments for each specific dataset.

data.name: RatingEmoprovements
data.value: Needs improvement (50-75%): The dataset meets a few of the FAIR principles in a good way, and needs to be improved in several areas.

data.name: RatingGood
data.value: Good (over 90%): The dataset adheres to the FAIR principles in a good way. You must do qualitative research yourself to assess any measures to further improve conditions regarding re-use.

data.name: RatingLabel
data.value: Explanation of assessment of FAIR principles:

data.name: RatingSatisfactory
data.value: Satisfactory (75-90%): The dataset meets many of the FAIR principles, but should be improved in several areas to ensure reuse.

data.name: RequirementsAtom
data.value: In order to achieve good fulfilment of requirements, the dataset must be available through an atomic feed service registered in Geonorge. Otherwise, status will be deficient .

data.name: RequirementsDownload
data.value: If the dataset is provided through an atom feed or a WFS where requirements are well met, this will qualify for good fulfilment of requirements. If the dataset is only available as WFS with usable fulfilment of requirements, this qualifies for the grade usable . Otherwise, status will be deficient .

data.name: RequirementsGml
data.value: In order to achieve good fulfilment of requirements, downloadable GML files must validate against UML model in the Data Product Specification. (It will be clear from the metadata whether GML files comply with the data product specification.) If there are downloadable GML files, then it will qualify for usable fulfilment of requirements. Otherwise, status will be deficient .

data.name: RequirementsMetadata
data.value: For metadata quality to be good, metadata must be validated in Geonorge's metadata editor. This means that all required fields must be filled in. Otherwise, metadata is considered as usable if they exists.

data.name: RequirementsProductSpesifications
data.value: In order to achieve good fulfilment of requirements, the metadata should link to an approved SOSI Data Product Specification for the dataset. Other referenced data product specifications may provide usable fulfilment of requirements. Otherwise, status will be deficient .

data.name: RequirementsSosi
data.value: In order to achieve good fulfilment of requirements, downloadable SOSI files must validate against the UML model in the Data Product Specification. It will be clear from the metadata whether SOSI files conform to the data product specification. If there are downloadable SOSI files, then it will qualify for usable fulfilment of requirements. Otherwise, status will be deficient .

data.name: RequirementsWfs
data.value: In order to achieve good fulfilment of requirements, the service must meet the most important requirements in Geonorge's application for service status. If there is a WFS service, it will qualify for usable fulfilment of requirements. In both cases, metadata must be linked to metadata of the dataset. Otherwise, status will be deficient .

data.name: RequirementsWms
data.value: In order to achieve good fulfilment of requirements, the service must meet the most important requirements in Geonorge's application for service status. If there is a WMS service, it will qualify for usable fulfilment of requirements. In both cases, metadata must be linked to metadata of the dataset. Otherwise, status will be deficient .

data.name: ReUseable_Description
data.value: The ultimate goal of FAIR is to optimise the reuse of data. To achieve this, metadata and data should be well-described so that they can be replicated and/or combined in different settings.

data.name: ReUseable_Label
data.value: Reusable

data.name: sedetaljer
data.value: Details

data.name: Smiley-Green-Description
data.value: green

data.name: Smiley-Red-Description
data.value: red

data.name: Smiley-Yellow-Description
data.value: yellow
